    Linking units

    This page introduces some of the units of measure that you can use to describe your data. It assumes that you have a rough understanding of what linked data is and where you might want to make use of it.

    If you already know which unit you want to reuse but want to find out how to use it, see the guide on reusing units.

    QUDT

    QUDT's Units Vocabulary is the preferred system of units recommended for use with csvcubed.

    Below we list a summary of some of the key units you may wish to use. Note that the units listed in this document are not exhaustive; if the unit that you want to represent has not been listed below then please refer to QUDT's Units Vocabulary to see if a suitable unit has already been published. If not, you may wish to define a new unit.

    Currencies

    e.g. average household income in a given region.

    Unit Identifier Quantity Kind
    Pound Sterling http://qudt.org/vocab/unit/PoundSterling Currency
    Euro http://qudt.org/vocab/unit/Euro Currency
    US Dollar http://qudt.org/vocab/unit/USDollar Currency

    Lengths

    e.g. distance from population centres to the nearest train station.

    Unit Identifier Quantity Kind
    Metre http://qudt.org/vocab/unit/M Length
    Yard http://qudt.org/vocab/unit/YD Length
    Mile http://qudt.org/vocab/unit/MI Length

    Areas

    e.g. Area of green space in a given locality.

    Unit Identifier Quantity Kind
    Square inch http://qudt.org/vocab/unit/IN2 Area
    Square metre http://qudt.org/vocab/unit/M2 Area
    Acre http://qudt.org/vocab/unit/AC Area
    Hectare http://qudt.org/vocab/unit/HA Area

    Volumes

    e.g. volume of potholes on roads in a given area.

    Unit Identifier Quantity Kind
    Litre http://qudt.org/vocab/unit/L Volume
    Cubic metre http://qudt.org/vocab/unit/M3 Volume
    Pint (UK) http://qudt.org/vocab/unit/PINT_UK Volume
    Teaspoon http://qudt.org/vocab/unit/TSP Volume
    Tablespoon http://qudt.org/vocab/unit/TBSP Volume
    Barrels (UK Petroleum) http://qudt.org/vocab/unit/BBL_UK_PET Volume

    Time Periods

    e.g. how long it takes an athlete to complete a 100m sprint.

    Unit Identifier Quantity Kind
    Seconds http://qudt.org/vocab/unit/SEC Time
    Minutes http://qudt.org/vocab/unit/MIN Time
    Hours http://qudt.org/vocab/unit/HR Time
    Days http://qudt.org/vocab/unit/DAY Time
    Years http://qudt.org/vocab/unit/YR Time

    Counts & rates

    e.g. the number of people observed sleeping rough in town centres on a given night.

    Unit Identifier Quantity Kind
    Number (count) http://qudt.org/vocab/unit/NUM Dimensionless
    Per day http://qudt.org/vocab/unit/PER-DAY Frequency
    Number per hour http://qudt.org/vocab/unit/NUM-PER-HR Frequency
    Hz http://qudt.org/vocab/unit/HZ Frequency

    Energies

    e.g. electrical energy consumption of households on a given day.

    Unit Identifier Quantity Kind
    kWh http://qudt.org/vocab/unit/KiloW-HR Energy
    Kilocalorie http://qudt.org/vocab/unit/KiloCAL Energy

    Temperatures

    e.g. daily observed maximum/minimum air temperatures.

    Unit Identifier Quantity Kind
    Degrees Celcius http://qudt.org/vocab/unit/DEG_C Temperature
    Degrees Kelvin http://qudt.org/vocab/unit/K Temperature

    Weights

    e.g. weights of new-born babies.

    Unit Identifier Quantity Kind
    Kilogramme http://qudt.org/vocab/unit/KiloGM Mass
    Metric Tonne http://qudt.org/vocab/unit/TON_Metric Mass
    Imperial Ton (UK) http://qudt.org/vocab/unit/TON_UK Mass
    Stone http://qudt.org/vocab/unit/Stone_UK Mass

    Ranks and ordinals

    e.g. the ranks/final positions of participants in a competition.

    Occasionally you may want to record the ranks or ordinals. Ranks do notÂ have a unit and so you should express this with the UNITLESS unit.

    Unit Identifier Quantity Kind
    Unitless http://qudt.org/vocab/unit/UNITLESS Dimensionless
